abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            assessed as highly satisfactory. The key lessons learned
            include: 1) Success of the project can be attributed to both
            the Borrower's and the Bank's approach to the
            project. The Bank utilized a multidisciplinary team of an
            economic/financial analyst, a port engineer, and a marine
            environmental specialist. This provided a consistency
            throughout the project, from design and appraisal to
            implementation. Further, 10 Chinese agencies and ministries
            were involved in the project. 2) Port and coastal
            environmental management is inherently complex due to
            overlapping jurisdictions of different departments and
            ministries, port authorities, and private interests. If
            China did not already have a strong and existing regulatory
            base upon which the project could be constructed, coupled
            with good leadership from Ministry of Communications, the
            project would have been much more difficult to implement and
            would likely have required more time. 3) The success of a
            ship waste project can be enhanced by a) adoption of an
            environmental coastal zone and port management plan; b)
            implementation of other pollution control activities; and c)
            control and management of land-based sources of pollution.
